==Trivia==
* ''Edzna'' is a {{w|Maya_civilization|Mayan}} archaeological site in the North of Campeche, Mexico.
** ''Edzna'' is the {{w|Yucatec_Maya_language|Yucatec Maya}} adaptation of the {{w|Chontal_Maya|Chontal Mayan}} word ''Itzna''.
===Etymology=== 
* ''Itzna'' name comes from the {{w|Chontal_Maya|Chontal Mayans}}, and means "House of the ''{{w|Itza_people|Itzaes}}''."
